page.title: 07Brass bands in Queensbury
page.content: The brass band tradition started with the mill providing a brass band for its workers rather than sports facilities. A brass band consists of brass instruments plus percussion. Some instruments are silver plated to protect the brass, which is a soft metal. (Quennsbury has five brass bands, all of national importance.) All take part in national contests, three have made records and appeared on television and radio. Through the educational system all children have the opportunity to learn a brass instrument. All the bands, which include (Jayess, Queensbury Music Centre, Versatile Brass) and the (Scout Band) are self supporting financially and have their own distinctive uniform.
